AYUB

JOB

 

 

Penulis: Ayub

Author: Job.

 

 

Waktu Penulisan: Menurut cara hidup Ayub yang mengembara (1:3) dan cara dia mempersembahkan kurban bakaran untuk anak-anaknya, kelihatannya kitab ini ditulis pada zaman Abraham, Ishak, dan Yakub (ay. 5; Kej. 22:13; 31:54), sekitar 2000 SM, lima ratus tahun sebelum Musa menulis Pentateukh.

Time of Writing: According to the way of Job's nomadic living (1:3) and the way he offered the burnt offering for his children, it seems that this book was written at the time of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob (v. 5; Gen. 22:13; 31:54), about 2000 B.C., five hundred years before Moses wrote the Pentateuch.

 

 

Tempat Penulisan: Di tanah Us (1:1), satu daerah sekutu Edom (Rat. 4:21), sebelah barat gurun pasir Arab.

Place of Writing: The land of Uz (1:1), an area associated with Edom (Lam. 4:21), west of the Arabian desert.

 

 

Rentang Waktu yang Tercakup: Periode yang dicakup kitab ini tidak dapat ditentukan dengan tepat; namun, setelah ujian-ujiannya Ayub masih hidup 140 tahun (42:16), membuat periode kitab ini hampir mencapai dua ratus tahun, sekitar 2000 SM yang lalu.

Time Period Covered: The period of time that this book covers cannot be determined with accuracy; however, after his trialsJob lived another 140 years (42:16), making the period of this book close to two hundred years, somewhere around 2000 B.C.

 

 

Pokok: Tujuan Penanggulangan Allah atas Orang Kudus-Nya

Subject of Job: The Purpose of God's Dealing with His Holy One

1:1 1Ada seorang laki-laki di tanah 2Us bernama 3aAyub; orang itu 4dsaleh dan jujur; ia takut akan Allah dan menjauhi kejahatan.

1:1 1 There was a man in the land of 2 Uz whose name was 3a Job; and this man was 4b perfect and upright, and he feared God and turned away from evil.

1:2 Ia mendapat atujuh anak laki-laki dan tiga anak perempuan.

1:2 And a seven sons and three daughters were born to him.

1:3 Ia memiliki tujuh ribu ekor kambing domba, tiga ribu ekor unta, lima ratus pasang lembu, lima ratus keledai betina dan budak-budak dalam jumlah yang sangat besar, sehingga orang itu adalah yang terkaya dari semua orang di sebelah timur.

1:3 And his possessions were seven thousand sheep and three thousand camels and five hundred yoke of oxen and five hundred female donkeys and a great many servants; and this man was greater than all the sons of the east.

1:4 Anak-anaknya yang lelaki biasa mengadakan pesta di rumah mereka masing-masing menurut giliran dan ketiga saudara perempuan mereka diundang untuk makan dan minum bersama-sama mereka.

1:4 And his sons would go and hold feasts in each ones house, each on his own day, and they would send word and invite their three sisters to eat and drink with them.

1:5 Setiap kali, apabila hari-hari pesta telah berlalu, Ayub memanggil mereka, dan 1menguduskan mereka; keesokan harinya, pagi-pagi, bangunlah Ayub, lalu mempersembahkan 1akurban bakaran sebanyak jumlah mereka sekalian, sebab pikirnya: Mungkin anak-anakku sudah berbuat dosa dan telah 2mengutuki Allah di dalam hati. Demikianlah dilakukan Ayub senantiasa.

1:5 And when the days of feasting ran their course, Job would send word and 1 sanctify them; and he would rise early in the morning and offer 1a burnt offerings according to the number of them all; for Job said, Perhaps my children have sinned and have 2 cursed God in their heart. Job did this continually.

1:15 datanglah orang-orang Syeba menyerang dan merampasnya serta memukul penjaganya dengan mata pedang. Hanya aku sendiri yang luput, sehingga dapat memberitahukan hal itu kepada tuan.

1:15 And the Sabeans fell upon them and took them away, and they struck the servants with the edge of the sword; and I alone have escaped to relate these things to you.

1:16 Sementara orang itu berbicara, datanglah orang lain dan berkata: 1Api telah menyambar dari langit dan membakar serta memakan habis kambing domba dan penjaga-penjaga. Hanya aku sendiri yang luput, sehingga dapat memberitahukan hal itu kepada tuan.

1:16 While this one was still speaking, another came and said, The 1 fire of God has fallen from heaven and burned up the sheep and the servants and devoured them; and I alone have escaped to relate these things to you.

1:17 Sementara orang itu berbicara, datanglah orang lain dan berkata: Orang-orang Kasdim membentuk tiga pasukan, lalu menyerbu unta-unta dan merampasnya serta memukul penjaganya dengan mata pedang. Hanya aku sendiri yang luput, sehingga dapat memberitahukan hal itu kepada tuan.

1:17 While this one was still speaking, another came and said, The Chaldeans formed three companies and raided the camels and took them, and they struck the servants with the edge of the sword; and I alone have escaped to relate these things to you.

1:18 Sementara orang itu berbicara, datanglah orang lain dan berkata: Anak-anak tuan yang lelaki dan yang perempuan sedang makan-makan dan minum anggur di rumah saudara mereka yang sulung,

1:18 While this one was still speaking, another came and said, Your sons and your daughters were eating and drinking wine in the house of their firstborn brother;

1:19 maka tiba-tiba angin ribut bertiup dari seberang padang gurun; rumah itu dilandanya pada empat penjurunya dan roboh menimpa orang-orang muda itu, sehingga mereka mati. Hanya aku sendiri yang luput, sehingga dapat memberitahukan hal itu kepada tuan.

1:19 And suddenly a great wind came from beyond the desert and struck the four corners of the house, so that it fell upon the young people and they died; and I alone have escaped to relate these things to you.

1:20 Maka berdirilah Ayub, lalu mengoyak jubahnya, dan mencukur kepalanya, kemudian sujudlah ia dan menyembah,

1:20 Then Job rose up and tore his clothes and shaved his head and fell to the earth and worshipped.

1:21 katanya: Dengan atelanjang aku keluar dari kandungan ibuku, dengan telanjang juga aku akan bkembali ke dalamnya. Tuhan yang cmemberi, Tuhan yang mengambil, terpujilah nama Tuhan!

1:21 And he said, a Naked I came out of my mothers womb, And naked I will b return there. Jehovah c gives and Jehovah takes away; Blessed be the name of Jehovah.

1:22 Dalam kesemuanya itu Ayub atidak berbuat dosa dan tidak menuduh Allah berbuat yang kurang patut.

1:22 In all this Job did a not sin, nor did he charge God with unseemliness.

Ia tetap tekun dalam akesalehannya, meskipun engkau telah membujuk Aku melawan dia untuk mencelakakannya tanpa alasan.

2:3 And Jehovah said to Satan, Have you 1 considered My servant Job? For there is none like him on the earth, a perfect and upright man, who fears God and turns away from evil. And he still holds fast his a integrity, though you have moved Me against him to destroy him without cause.

2:12 And when they lifted up their eyes from a distance and did not recognize him, they lifted up their voice and wept; and they all tore their clothes and cast dust over their heads toward heaven.

2:13 Lalu mereka duduk bersama-sama dia di tanah selama atujuh hari tujuh malam. Seorang pun 1tidak mengucapkan sepatah kata kepadanya, karena mereka melihat, bahwa sangat berat penderitaannya.

2:13 And they sat with him on the ground a seven days and seven nights; but 1 none spoke a word to him, for they saw that his pain was very great.
